title: Devasena Diamond Haaram with Temple Jhumka Pendants
materials: Seed Pearls. Hyderabadi Polish for lasting sheen and durability.
features: Intricately crafted with a classic paisley (manga malai) design along the collar. Features a central floral pendant with a peacock motif, a symbol of beauty and royalty. Adorned with delicate temple jhumka pendants featuring traditional filigree work and pearl drops. Fine detailing with closed setting (kundan setting) to enhance the brilliance of the uncut diamonds. Inspired by Temple Jewellery. The necklace has a high-quality adjustable dori.
colors: Primarily gold with the brilliance of uncut diamonds. Emerald and ruby accents provide vibrant pops of green and red
creating a rich and regal color palette.
occasions: and grand celebrations. Also suitable for adding a touch of heritage to modern formal events.
description: A timeless statement piece showcasing exquisite craftsmanship. The use of uncut diamonds and traditional techniques makes it a valuable heirloom. Symbolizes prosperity and good fortune, ideal for auspicious occasions. The Haaram's flexible design ensures a comfortable fit. A blend of traditional South Indian artistry with contemporary sensibilities.
